description.en: This course will focus on the role that culture plays in business and management and the impacts of cultural differences on business and management practices. This includes language, habits, traditions, nationality, religion, gender and age. Students will learn how to manage different staff within an organisation, including their education and training needs, as well as managing consumer and client relationships. Emphasis will also be placed on the challenges of doing global business in national, regional and local contexts.
description.et: Kursus keskendub kultuuri rollile ettevõtluses ja juhtimises ning kultuuriliste erinevuste mõjule äris ja juhtimises. Kursus hõlmab keelt, harjumusi, traditsioone, rahvust, usku, sugu ja vanust. Õpitakse, kuidas juhtida organisatsioonis erinevaid töötajaid, sealhulgas nende haridus- ja koolitusvajadusi. Käsitletakse tarbija- ja kliendisuhete haldamist. Rõhku pannakse ka väljakutsetele, mis on seotud globaalse ettevõtlusega riiklikus, piirkondlikus ja kohalikus kontekstis.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to analyse the role of culture in business and management, to assess the impact of cultural differences on business and management practices, and to evaluate how cultural differences can be managed in business and management situations.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on analüüsida kultuuri rolli äris ja juhtimises, hinnata kultturierinevuste mõju äri- ja juhtimispraktikas, hinnata, kuidas tegeleda kultuurierinevustega erinevates äri- ja juhtimissituatsioonides.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the students will gain an understanding of:
* the role of culture in business and management;
* the impact of cultural differences on business and management practices;
* the management of cultural dilemmas and conflicts;
* the educational and training needs of managers and staff for dealing with different cultural groups;
learning_outcomes.et: * juhtide haridus- ja koolitusvajadusi, et juhtida erineva kultuuritaustaga inimesi;

learning_outcomes.en: * the different cultural needs of customers and clients.

description.et:
Coursework (50%):

*	Business report format should be followed
*	A thorough understanding of the given business or organisation must be shown
*	Clear identification of the cross-cultural issues for this business or organisation must be given
*	Analytical and critical thinking must be employed beyond description or listing of basic information
*	Recommendations must be made for dealing with customers and/or clients
*	Education and training needs of staff must be identified
*	Evidence of reading and research is needed in the form of a References list or Bibliography

Examination (50%)

To score highly, students must demonstrate:

*	Detailed knowledge of the role of culture in business and management
*	Awareness of the impacts of cultural differences (e.g. language, nationality, religion, gender, age) on business and management practices
*	An understanding of how to do global business in national, regional and local contexts
*	Awareness of the cross-cultural educational and training needs of managers and staff 
*	Recognition of how culture can affect customers' and clients' needs
*	Examples of good or interesting practice

grade_evaluation.et:
*	A coursework in which students are asked to consider the cross-cultural issues in an existing or fictional business or organisation (50%)
*	A 60 minute examination with short-answer questions (50%)
